summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling its previous resolutions on the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (ICTR), particularly 955 (1994), 1503 (2003), and 1901 (2009),

Noting the ICTR's Completion Strategy Report indicating that it will not complete its work by 2010,

Concerned about staff retention and its impact on the timely completion of the ICTR's work,

Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,

1. Reaffirms the necessity of trials for ICTR indictees and calls on states, particularly in the Great Lakes region, to cooperate with and assist the ICTR, specifically in bringing Felicien Kabuga, Augustin Bizimana, and Protais Mpiranya to justice.

2. Emphasizes the importance of adequate staffing for the ICTR to complete its work expeditiously and calls on the Secretariat and relevant UN bodies to work with the ICTR Registrar to address staffing issues.

3. Extends the terms of office of the following judges in the Appeals Chamber until 31 December 2012 or until completion of their assigned cases:

- Mehmet Güney (Turkey)
- Andrésia Vaz (Senegal)

4. Extends the terms of office of the following judges in the Trial Chamber until 31 December 2011 or until completion of their assigned cases:

- Charles Michael Dennis Byron (Saint Kitts and Nevis)
- Khalida Rachid Khan (Pakistan)
- Arlette Ramaroson (Madagascar)
- William H. Sekule (United Republic of Tanzania)
- Bakhtiyar Tuzmukhamedov (Russian Federation)
The Security Council:

1. Decides to extend the term of office of 10 ad litem judges at the International Tribunal, members of the Trial Chamber, until 31 December 2011 or until completion of assigned cases, if sooner: 
Aydin Sefa Akay (Turkey), 
Florence Rita Arrey (Cameroon), 
Solomy Balungi Bossa (Uganda), 
Vagn Joensen (Denmark), 
Gberdao Gustave Kam (Burkina Faso), 
Lee Gacuiga Muthoga (Kenya), 
Seon Ki Park (Republic of Korea), 
Mparany Mamy Richard Rajohnson (Madagascar), 
Emile Francis Short (Ghana).

2. Amends article 12 ter of the Statute of the International Tribunal as set out in the annex.

 Article 12 ter: 
If no ad litem judges are on the roster or available, and no serving judge can be assigned, 
the Secretary-General, at the President's request, may appoint a former permanent or ad litem judge 
of either Tribunal to serve as an ad litem judge in the Trial Chambers.

3. Urges the International Tribunal to complete its work expeditiously.

4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
